documents.title: non-domestic rating ( multiplier ) ( wales ) order 2018 approved
text: ams approve the draft non-domestic rating ( multiplier ) ( wales ) order 2018 .

documents.title: final budget 2018-19 approved
text: the welsh government 's £ 15 billion spending plans are approved .

documents.title: settlement 'less damaging ' than previous ones
text: plaid cymru 's sian gwenllian says it is `` blatantly obvious that austerity is not working '' .
she says the settlement is `` less damaging '' than previous ones , but still does not allow councils to meet many welsh government priorities .

documents.title: 'fundamental review of funding formula needed '
text: conservative janet finch-saunders calls for a `` fundamental review of the funding formula '' with , for example , greater consideration for demographics and the needs of rural communities .

documents.title: extra £ 20m in 2018-19 for councils
text: the final debate today is on the local government settlement 2018-19 .
it was announced in december that local government will be given an extra £ 20m in 2018-19 as a result of increased public spending in england - the so-called barnett formula .
this is on top of the £ 3.3bn earmarked for councils in the draft budget in october .
welsh local government association ( wlga ) leader debbie wilcox had previously warned councils could not keep making the `` harshest '' of cuts while maintaining service levels .
according to the welsh government , the final settlement represents a slight cash increase overall , equivalent to an increase of 0.2 % after adjusting for transfers .

documents.title: 'there has not been an agenda of austerity '
text: ukip leader neil hamilton says `` the idea this conservative government has followed an agenda of austerity is nonsense '' .

documents.title: budget deal : plaid cymru commitments
text: adam price says the budget deal forged between plaid cymru and labour will deliver tangible benefits for people 's lives .
the deal , said to be worth £ 210m , includes £ 40m to boost mental health funding and £ 40m for higher and further education between 2018 and 2020 .

text: conservative nick ramsay accuses mark drakeford of having an `` overtly negative tone '' , given the `` increased funding delivered for wales '' by the uk government .

documents.title: budget to be put to a vote
text: we move on to a debate on the the welsh government 's final budget 2018-19 .
the government 's £ 15.3bn outline budget proposals were published on 3 october 2017 .
plaid cymru has already agreed to back welsh labour 's spending plans to ensure the budget is passed .

documents.title: 'extraordinary level of fraud ' related to the european health insurance card
text: ukip 's caroline jones says the report `` starkly lays out the actions needed '' .
`` we ca n't continue to deliver nhs services as we did 70 years ago , '' she adds .
she cites the need to tackle the `` extraordinary level of fraud '' related to the european health insurance card .

documents.title: 'indictment ' of labour 's management of health and social care
text: plaid cymru 's rhun ap iorwerth says the report shows there is no vision for health and social care in wales , which he describes as an `` indictment '' of labour 's management over the last two decades .
he seeks clarity as to how the government will measure success of its new long-term plan .

documents.title: 'the case for change is compelling '
text: angela burns says the welsh conservatives strongly support the review and its recommendations , and she urges the welsh government not to delay in making the changes the health and care sectors `` so desperately need '' .
`` the case for change is compelling , '' she says .

documents.title: new long-term plan for health and social care in the spring
text: health secretary vaughan gething says he would `` carefully consider '' the findings ahead of a new long-term plan for health and social care to be published in the spring .
`` i believe that what we have seen today from the panel will set firm foundations for the future of health and social care in wales for many years to come , '' he says .

documents.title: 'significant test of leadership at national , regional and local level '
text: nine leading international experts , chaired by the former chief medical officer for wales dr ruth hussey , have been looking at ways to try to put the health and social care system on a stronger footing .
its findings propose 10 recommendations , including :
but it warns that there is too much focus on narrow hospital targets rather than looking at the bigger
it wants a new national transformation programme to drive forward changes .
however the panel warns this `` wo n't be easy '' and will involve `` significant test of leadership at national , regional and local level '' .

documents.title: nhs and social care will be expected to work 'seamlessly '
text: we move on to a statement by the cabinet secretary for health and social services vaughan gething on the parliamentary review of health and social care in wales .
a `` revolution '' is urgently needed in the way health and social care is delivered in wales says the major review .
without `` significantly accelerated '' change , services which are already not fit for the future , will further decline , the expert panel warns .
the nhs and social care will be expected to work `` seamlessly '' together to respond to a person 's needs and to deliver care closer to home .

documents.title: 'disrespectful to all those that fought so hard to create a welsh democracy '
text: plaid cymru am adam price refers to the welsh government 's failure to win three votes in the assembly last week .
he quotes a welsh government source 's response to the bbc : `` opposition day votes are - in many ways - meaningless .
`` they are n't binding and do n't have any bearing on government policy or delivery '' .
mr price says those comments are `` disrespectful to all those that fought so hard to create a welsh democracy '' .
julie james replies `` it 's a shame that the consensual way this place has always operated has broken down '' .

documents.title: business statement and announcement
text: the next item is the business statement and announcement .
leader of the house julie james outlines the assembly 's future business and responds to requests from ams .

documents.title: 'aware of stories about superfast broadband infrastructure being left unfinished '
text: the first minister says the welsh government is aware of stories about superfast broadband infrastructure being left unfinished - he says it is being considered what further steps could be taken after the contract finished .
it has been claimed a ceredigion village has been `` abandoned '' by bt after it failed to finish installing superfast broadband .

text: 'you expect public to pay for your mistakes '

text: some of @ twitterid responses in # fmqs are long - really , really long .
its not quite a punchy back and forth .

documents.title: 'no answers to the real challenges facing wales '
text: andrew rt davies says wages are only mentioned twice in the welsh government 's economic strategy , while automation is barely mentioned .
he claims there are no answers to the real challenges facing wales .
the first minister says he wants to make wales a destination where companies from all around the world want to come .
mr davies calls the first minister 's lengthy answer on his vision for the economy a `` ladybird analogy '' .

documents.title: 'wo n't sell wales as a source of cheap labour '
text: why should the latest welsh government economic strategy succeed when three predecessors have failed , asks conservative leader andrew rt davies .
the first minister says the welsh government wo n't sell wales as a source of cheap labour for foreign companies as tories did pre-devolution .

documents.title: 'waiting up to six hours for an ambulance '
text: is enough being done to support the well-being nhs staff , asks plaid cymru leader leanne wood .
the first minister says health boards are encouraged to ensure staff feel supported .

ms wood claims that in the past few weeks patients categorised as suitable for a 20 minute response have had to wait up to six hours for an ambulance , including people who have had strokes or heart attacks .
the first minister promises to put this to the ambulance trust and then write to leanne wood .

documents.title: 'i do n't think anybody could have known the scale of problems in carillion '
text: on welsh rail , neil hamilton asks whether there was any action after a profit warning was issued in july to protect the bidding process against any possible collapse by carillion .
the first minister replies , `` i do n't think anybody , let alone the uk government , could have known the scale of problems in carillion '' .

documents.title: discussions with abellio about the 'complex situation '
text: ukip leader neil hamilton says it was n't clear from mark drakeford 's answer earlier what impact carillion 's collapse will have on the bid by abellio , which carillion was a part of , for the welsh rail franchise .
the first minister says they are in discussions with abellio about the `` complex situation '' and emphasises that carillion was a `` part '' of the consortium making the bid .

documents.title: loss of monmouthshire 's 'entire inpatient dementia provision '
text: conservative nick ramsay raises the planned closure of the inpatient dementia ward at chepstow hospital , stating `` if this goes ahead it will represent the loss of monmouthshire 's entire inpatient dementia provision '' .

documents.title: animals in circuses in wales
text: we move on to questions to the first minister .
the first of the tabled questions is by joyce watson : does the welsh government intend to ban wild animals in circuses in wales ?
the first minister says there will be a statement before the spring half term recess .

documents.title: mark drakeford 'fired up'bbc journalists tweet
text: quite enjoyed that preview of the welsh labour leadership hustings in the senedd .
rare to see mark drakeford so fired up in # fmqs about downfall of carillion .
very leader-like .

documents.title: 'investigations into carillion should extend to government ministers '
text: labour am mick antoniw says investigations into carillion should extend to government ministers and adds : `` is n't it the fact that we have economic model that is basically about squeezing profits for the few and expecting the public at the end of the day to bail them out '' .

mark drakeford agrees and , pointing at the conservative benches , in a fiery speech says : `` yes there are lessons to be taken from carillion , luckily in wales we learned them well before the party opposite . ''

documents.title: businesses and subcontractors might 'find themselves exposed '
text: mr drakeford adds that welsh businesses and subcontractors might find themselves exposed '' after carillion 's demise , but the welsh government will offer such help as we are able to '' .

documents.title: legal advice on any impact on rail franchise process
text: carillion was part of a bid for the next welsh rail franchise .
mr drakeford says ken skates is taking legal advice on whether the collapse would have any impact on the franchise process ,

documents.title: 'little direct impact in wales '
text: finance secretary mark drakeford says he expects `` little direct impact in wales , but the government will do everything possible to help carillion workers in wales '' .
mr drakeford says carillion has one contract with the welsh government over the design of junctions on the a55 .

text: prynhawn da .
plenary gets underway at 1.30pm with an emergency question .
plaid cymru 's adam price asks what plans has the welsh government made to respond to the consequences of carillion entering liquidation ?
britain 's second largest construction firm , which employs 20,000 people in the uk , went bust on monday with debts of about £ 1.5bn .
